title: G Major Scale
description: Learn the G major scale — your first scale with a sharp note (F#).

steps.title: G Major — One Sharp
steps.description: The G major scale follows the same whole-whole-half-whole-whole-whole-half pattern as C major, but it starts on G. This means one note changes: F becomes F# (F sharp). The notes are G, A, B, C, D, E, F#.

steps.title: Find G
steps.description: Press G4 to start. G is the white key between the first and second keys of the group of three black keys.

steps.title: Find F# (F Sharp)
steps.description: F# is the black key between F and G. This is the one sharp in the G major scale.
steps.hint: F#5 is MIDI note 78. It's the black key just below G5.

steps.title: Play the G Major Scale
steps.description: Play all 7 notes ascending: G, A, B, C, D, E, F#. Remember — F is replaced by F#!
steps.hint: All white keys from G to F#, except F becomes F# (the black key).

steps.title: Play G Major Chord
steps.description: Play the G major chord: G, B, D.

steps.title: G Major Quiz
steps.description: Which note is sharp in the G major scale?
